Account Information : • Account Number: 5179 749 6023 • Statement Date: 12/15/23 Service Recipient : • Service provided to: TOWN OF BERLIN PUBLIC GROUNDS Dimensions & Placement : • Logo is positioned at the top, with account and service information directly below. Analysis : • The use of blue and green in the logo suggests an association with energy, environment, or sustainability, consistent with a utility provider. The clear presentation of account and service details supports official billing or correspondence. Summary : This image shows a utility bill summary with itemized charges, payments, and the total amount due by a specified date, including a highlighted current charge. bill summary: Total Amount Due : • Original total amount due: $133.35 (crossed out). • New total amount due: $133.35 (not crossed out). • Due date: 02/13/24. Itemized Charges : • Amount Due On 12/11/23: $135.95. • Last Payment Received On 11/22/23: -$72.18. • Balance Forward: $63.77. • Total Current Charges: $69.58 (highlighted in yellow and circled in blue). Design Encodings : • Green background for the total amount due section. • Yellow highlight and blue circle around "Total Current Charges: $69.58". • Strikethrough on the original total amount due. Analysis : • The bill details a previous balance, a payment received, and new charges, resulting in a total amount due of $133.35 by 02/13/24. • The current charges of $69.58 are visually emphasized, possibly indicating their importance for the current billing cycle. • The strikethrough on the total amount due may indicate a correction or update to the amount. Summary : This bar chart displays the daily electric usage in kilowatt hours (kWh) for each month, alongside the average temperature for each month, over a one-year period. bar chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "Electric Usage History - Kilowatt Hours (kWh)" • Y-axis: "kWh/Day", with tick marks at 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. • X-axis: Months from Dec to Dec (13 bars), each labeled with the month and average temperature (°F) below: Dec 35°, Jan 38°, Feb 35°, Mar 41°, Apr 54°, May 60°, Jun 68°, Jul 72°, Aug 72°, Sep 67°, Oct 58°, Nov 41°, Dec 40°. # Data Points : • Each bar represents average daily electric usage (kWh/day) for the corresponding month. • Heights (approximate, as exact values are not labeled): – Dec (35°): ~4.1 – Jan (38°): ~4.0 – Feb (35°): ~3.7 – Mar (41°): ~3.3 – Apr (54°): ~3.7 – May (60°): ~3.1 – Jun (68°): ~3.1 – Jul (72°): ~3.1 – Aug (72°): ~3.1 – Sep (67°): ~3.6 – Oct (58°): ~4.6 (highest) – Nov (41°): ~3.8 – Dec (40°): ~4.2 (green bar) # Design Encodings : • Bars are gray except for the last (Dec 40°), which is green. • Each bar is labeled below with the month and average temperature. • No gridlines or error bars are present. # Distribution & Trends : • Electric usage is higher in colder months (Dec, Jan, Feb, Oct, Nov, Dec). • Usage is lower and relatively flat during warmer months (May–Aug). • October shows the highest usage (~4.6 kWh/day). • The green bar for the last December indicates a new or forecasted value. # Analysis : • Electric usage is seasonally variable, peaking in colder months and dipping in warmer months, suggesting heating as a major driver. • October stands out as an outlier with the highest usage. • The green bar for the last December may indicate a projected or current value, slightly higher than the previous December. • The pattern suggests a strong correlation between lower average temperatures and higher electric usage. Summary : This figure presents the current charges for electricity, broken down into supply and delivery components, with their respective costs and providers, using a horizontal bar to visually compare the amounts. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Current Charges for Electricity". • No explicit axis labels, but the horizontal axis represents cost in dollars ($), ranging from $0 to $75 with tick marks at $0, $15, $30, $45, $60, and $75. • No vertical axis; categories are shown as text above the bar. Data Points : • Supply (NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN): $10.64. • Delivery (Eversource): $58.94. Design Encodings : • Supply cost is shown in blue, delivery cost in green. • Both costs are displayed as adjacent segments of a single horizontal bar, with the supply segment starting at $0 and the delivery segment continuing from the end of the supply segment. • Large, bolded dollar amounts ($10.64 in blue, $58.94 in green) are shown above the respective segments. • Provider names are listed below each cost. Distribution & Trends : • The delivery charge ($58.94) is substantially larger than the supply charge ($10.64). • The combined total visually approaches $70. Analysis : • The delivery cost from Eversource makes up the majority of the total electricity charge, being more than five times the supply cost from NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN. • The visual emphasis and color coding highlight the disparity between supply and delivery charges. Summary : This image shows a section of a form related to electric supply, containing a purchase order number, date, and signature, as well as supplier contact information. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a filled-out form section with handwritten entries and printed supplier details. • The form is oriented horizontally, with a white background and colored text (red, black, blue). • Lighting is even, with no visible shadows or glare. Technical Details : • Printed text: "Your electric supplier is NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN 20455 STATE HIGHWAY 249 HOUSTON TX 77070-2757 800-882-1276". • Form fields: "PO#", "Date", "Sig." in large red font, each followed by a handwritten entry. • Handwritten entries: "PO# 240171", "Date 1-4-2024", "Sig." with a stylized signature. • Blue ink circle with "MT" written inside, located in the upper left. • Three horizontal pink lines separate the fields. Spatial Relationships : • Supplier information is in the upper right. • Form fields and handwritten entries are left-aligned, occupying the left and center. • The blue "MT" circle is in the upper left margin. Analysis : • The image documents the completion of a form, confirming a purchase order (PO# 240171) dated 1-4-2024, with a signature and supplier contact details. The blue "MT" annotation may indicate review or approval. Electric Usage Summary This month your average daily electric use was 4.0 kWh This month your usage stayed the same compared to same time last year. 0 % USAGE ↓ News For You A new discount for electric bills is available if you have a financial hardship status on your electric account. Based on your household income or receipt of a public assistance benefit, you may be eligible for a 10% or 50% discount off your electric bill per month. For example, if you have a $100 monthly bill, it would be $10 less if you receive a 10% discount or $50 less if you receive the 50% discount. See how to enroll at eversource.com/billhelp. Remit Payment To: Eversource, PO Box 56002, Boston, MA 02205-6002 Please make your check payable to Eversource and consider adding $1 for Operation Fuel. You can also add $2 or $3 when paying your bill online. 100% of your tax-deductible donation provides energy assistance grants. If mailing, please allow up to 5 business days to post. logo: EVERSOURCE Summary : This image is a logo for the company "EVERSOURCE". Logo Elements : • The word "EVERSOURCE" is written in uppercase, sans-serif, dark gray letters. • The letter "O" in "SOURCE" is stylized as a circle divided into three horizontal bands: the top band is blue, the middle band is white, and the bottom band is green. Dimensions & Placement : • The logo is horizontally oriented with all letters on a single line. • The stylized "O" is centered within the word. Analysis : • The use of blue and green in the "O" suggests themes of energy, environment, or sustainability, aligning with the company's utility sector branding. Address Block : • Recipient: Eversource • PO Box 56002 • Boston, MA 02205-6002 Analysis : • The barcode is likely a USPS POSTNET or Intelligent Mail barcode used for automated mail sorting. • The address is formatted for postal delivery to a PO Box in Boston, MA, with ZIP+4 code 02205-6002. Summary : This image shows a small, square, high-contrast black-and-white pattern above the number "24", consistent with a barcode or matrix code. barcode: Type & Structure : • 2D matrix barcode (likely DataMatrix or QR code, but exact type not specified). • Approximate module count: 12 × 12. • Quiet zone: present on all sides, especially bottom and right. • No visible alphanumeric string within the barcode itself. Placement & Context : • Barcode is positioned above the number "24", which is centered and printed in a sans-serif font. • No other visible text, labels, or graphical elements. • Barcode and number are vertically aligned. Analysis : • The barcode is likely used for identification or indexing, with "24" serving as a human-readable reference or label for the encoded data. • No branding, product information, or additional context is visible in this crop. 5179749602353 0000133355 0000069588 Summary : This image shows the Eversource company logo and an account number. logo: Company Name : • "EVERSOURCE" in bold uppercase letters. • The "O" in "SOURCE" is stylized as a circle divided horizontally into three bands: top band is blue, middle band is white, bottom band is green. Account Number : • Text "Account Number:" followed by the number "5179 749 6023" in bold. Analysis : • The logo’s use of blue and green, along with the stylized "O", likely signals a focus on energy and environmental responsibility. The account number is clearly presented for customer identification. CE_231215PROD.TXT-6110-000046130 Summary : This image shows the Eversource company logo and account information for a utility service bill addressed to the Town of Berlin Public Grounds, including account number, customer key, and statement date. logo: EVERSOURCE utility company Logo & Text Elements : • "EVERSOURCE" in bold uppercase letters, with the "O" replaced by a blue and green circle divided by a white horizontal line. • Account Number: 5179 749 6023 • Customer name key: BERL • Statement Date: 12/15/23 • Service Provided To: TOWN OF BERLIN PUBLIC GROUNDS Design & Placement : • Logo is at the top, followed by account and service information in a stacked, left-aligned format. • The blue and green circle in the logo visually represents the "O" in "EVERSOURCE". Analysis : • The logo uses green and blue to suggest environmental responsibility and energy, consistent with a utility provider's branding. • The information is clearly organized for quick reference by the recipient. Total Amount Due: $133.35 by 02/13/24 Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity supply rate in dollars per kilowatt-hour (kWh) from December through the following December. bar chart: Title & Axes : • No explicit chart title; context suggests "Supply Rate". • Y-axis: "Dollars / kWh", ranging from 0 to 0.1. • X-axis: Months, labeled Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec. Data Points : • Each bar represents the supply rate for a given month. • Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar: approximately 0.06 dollars/kWh. • Apr, May, Jun: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh. • Jul: slightly below 0.08 dollars/kWh. • Aug: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh. • Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec: approximately 0.07 dollars/kWh. Design Encodings : • Bars are grey except the final December bar, which is green. • No gridlines or data labels. • Uniform bar width. Distribution & Trends : • Rates are stable at ~0.06 from Dec–Mar. • Increase to ~0.08 from Apr–Jun. • Slight dip in Jul, then return to ~0.08 in Aug. • Drop to ~0.07 from Sep–Dec. Analysis : • The supply rate is lowest in winter (Dec–Mar), rises in spring (Apr–Jun), peaks in late spring and summer, and then decreases but remains above winter levels in the fall and early winter. • The green bar for the final December may indicate a forecast or special status. Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly maximum demand profile over a one-year period, highlighting a significant dip in March and otherwise consistent demand levels. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Demand Profile" • Y-axis: "Max. Demand" (units not specified), range from 0 to 2.5 • X-axis: Months from Dec to Dec (13 months: Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec) • Y-axis tick labels: 0, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 Data Points : • Dec: ~2.0 • Jan: ~2.0 • Feb: ~2.0 • Mar: ~1.0 • Apr: ~2.0 • May: ~2.0 • Jun: ~2.0 • Jul: ~2.0 • Aug: ~2.0 • Sep: ~2.0 • Oct: ~2.0 • Nov: ~2.0 • Dec (second): ~2.0 (bar is green, others are grey) Design Encodings : • All bars are grey except the final December bar, which is green. • Uniform bar width and spacing. • No gridlines or error bars. Distribution & Trends : • Demand is stable at ~2.0 for all months except March, which drops to ~1.0. • No other significant fluctuations or outliers. Analysis : • The demand profile is highly consistent except for a pronounced dip in March. • The green bar for the final December may indicate a forecast, target, or special status, but this is not specified in the image. • The pattern suggests a single, isolated anomaly in March, with otherwise steady demand throughout the year. Summary : This image shows a small, square, high-contrast black-and-white pattern typical of a 2D barcode, likely a DataMatrix or QR code, with no visible text or numbers. barcode: Type & Structure : • 2D barcode, likely DataMatrix (based on square shape and dense, modular pattern). • Approximate module count: 14 × 14. • Quiet zone: present on all sides, especially bottom and right. • No visible numeric or alphanumeric string. • No human-readable text or logo present. Dimensions & Placement : • Square aspect ratio. • Barcode fills most of the crop, with a thin white border. Analysis : • The barcode is machine-readable and intended for compact data encoding; no human-interpretable information is visible in the image. CE_231215PROD.TXT-6111-000046130

  Design Encodings :

Analysis :

Summary : This bar chart displays the daily electric usage in kilowatt hours (kWh) for each month, alongside the average temperature for each month, over a one-year period.

bar chart:

# Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Electric Usage History - Kilowatt Hours (kWh)"
  • Y-axis: "kWh/Day", with tick marks at 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
  • X-axis: Months from Dec to Dec (13 bars), each labeled with the month and average temperature (°F) below: Dec 35°, Jan 38°, Feb 35°, Mar 41°, Apr 54°, May 60°, Jun 68°, Jul 72°, Aug 72°, Sep 67°, Oct 58°, Nov 41°, Dec 40°.

# Data Points :
  • Each bar represents average daily electric usage (kWh/day) for the corresponding month.
  • Heights (approximate, as exact values are not labeled):
    – Dec (35°): ~4.1
    – Jan (38°): ~4.0
    – Feb (35°): ~3.7
    – Mar (41°): ~3.3
    – Apr (54°): ~3.7
    – May (60°): ~3.1
    – Jun (68°): ~3.1
    – Jul (72°): ~3.1
    – Aug (72°): ~3.1
    – Sep (67°): ~3.6
    – Oct (58°): ~4.6 (highest)
    – Nov (41°): ~3.8
    – Dec (40°): ~4.2 (green bar)

# Design Encodings :
  • Bars are gray except for the last (Dec 40°), which is green.
  • Each bar is labeled below with the month and average temperature.
  • No gridlines or error bars are present.

# Distribution & Trends :
  • Electric usage is higher in colder months (Dec, Jan, Feb, Oct, Nov, Dec).
  • Usage is lower and relatively flat during warmer months (May–Aug).
  • October shows the highest usage (~4.6 kWh/day).
  • The green bar for the last December indicates a new or forecasted value.

# Analysis :
  • Electric usage is seasonally variable, peaking in colder months and dipping in warmer months, suggesting heating as a major driver.
  • October stands out as an outlier with the highest usage.
  • The green bar for the last December may indicate a projected or current value, slightly higher than the previous December.
  • The pattern suggests a strong correlation between lower average temperatures and higher electric usage.

Summary : This figure presents the current charges for electricity, broken down into supply and delivery components, with their respective costs and providers, using a horizontal bar to visually compare the amounts.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Current Charges for Electricity".
  • No explicit axis labels, but the horizontal axis represents cost in dollars ($), ranging from $0 to $75 with tick marks at $0, $15, $30, $45, $60, and $75.
  • No vertical axis; categories are shown as text above the bar.

Data Points :
  • Supply (NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN): $10.64.
  • Delivery (Eversource): $58.94.

Design Encodings :
  • Supply cost is shown in blue, delivery cost in green.
  • Both costs are displayed as adjacent segments of a single horizontal bar, with the supply segment starting at $0 and the delivery segment continuing from the end of the supply segment.
  • Large, bolded dollar amounts ($10.64 in blue, $58.94 in green) are shown above the respective segments.
  • Provider names are listed below each cost.

Distribution & Trends :
  • The delivery charge ($58.94) is substantially larger than the supply charge ($10.64).
  • The combined total visually approaches $70.

Analysis :
  • The delivery cost from Eversource makes up the majority of the total electricity charge, being more than five times the supply cost from NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN.
  • The visual emphasis and color coding highlight the disparity between supply and delivery charges.

Summary : This image shows a section of a form related to electric supply, containing a purchase order number, date, and signature, as well as supplier contact information.

photo:

Electric Usage Summary

This month your average daily electric use was  
4.0 kWh

This month your usage stayed the same compared to same time last year.

0 %  
USAGE  
↓

News For You

A new discount for electric bills is available if you have a financial hardship status on your electric account. Based on your household income or receipt of a public assistance benefit, you may be eligible for a 10% or 50% discount off your electric bill per month. For example, if you have a $100 monthly bill, it would be $10 less if you receive a 10% discount or $50 less if you receive the 50% discount. See how to enroll at eversource.com/billhelp.
Remit Payment To: Eversource, PO Box 56002, Boston, MA 02205-6002

Please make your check payable to Eversource and consider adding $1 for Operation Fuel. You can also add $2 or $3 when paying your bill online. 100% of your tax-deductible donation provides energy assistance grants. If mailing, please allow up to 5 business days to post.

Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity supply rate in dollars per kilowatt-hour (kWh) from December through the following December.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • No explicit chart title; context suggests "Supply Rate".
  • Y-axis: "Dollars / kWh", ranging from 0 to 0.1.
  • X-axis: Months, labeled Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec.

Data Points :
  • Each bar represents the supply rate for a given month.
  • Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar: approximately 0.06 dollars/kWh.
  • Apr, May, Jun: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh.
  • Jul: slightly below 0.08 dollars/kWh.
  • Aug: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh.
  • Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec: approximately 0.07 dollars/kWh.

Design Encodings :
  • Bars are grey except the final December bar, which is green.
  • No gridlines or data labels.
  • Uniform bar width.

Distribution & Trends :
  • Rates are stable at ~0.06 from Dec–Mar.
  • Increase to ~0.08 from Apr–Jun.
  • Slight dip in Jul, then return to ~0.08 in Aug.
  • Drop to ~0.07 from Sep–Dec.

Analysis :
  • The supply rate is lowest in winter (Dec–Mar), rises in spring (Apr–Jun), peaks in late spring and summer, and then decreases but remains above winter levels in the fall and early winter.
  • The green bar for the final December may indicate a forecast or special status.
